desc: The ability to reproduce is one of the key features of a living organism. Studying the biology of reproduction requires a synthesis of information and concepts from a wide range of fields within biology. This course addresses reproduction at the genetic, organismal, and population levels. Laboratory work adds a valuable investigative component to the course, and social/psychological issues are addresssed throughout. Prerequisites: Biology 125 and 126, or permission of instructor.
name: Biology of Reproduction
notes: Students in Bio 275 must also register for one lab Bio 275 AL or BL. This course has class-year limits.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Biology 125 and 126, or permission of instructor.
